The pipeline parameters

The two primary pipelines - and some of the other code examples - use a set of parameters that are taken from several sources - both names and values. This table documents, the different names the parameters appear under, how and where to define them, where the parameters are read from, how to determine which value to specify as used in the PipelineConfigclass and the Mainframe_CI_Pipeline_from_Shared_Lib.

Parameter / Description Name in PipelineConfig class Alias Passed to pipeline via Defined where How to determine
Runner jcl to use for unit test execution tttJcl N/A Email List configuration file mailRecipient Manage Jenkins -> Managed Files The email file contains TSO user : email address pairs. The owner of the ISPW set will be taken as lookup for the email address</code>
Recipient of emails sent by the pipeline informing the owner of the ISPW set about the results mailRecipient N/A Email List configuration file mailList.config Manage Jenkins -> Managed Files The email file contains TSO user : email address pairs. The owner of the ISPW set will be taken as lookup for the email address</code>
Git project name of repository storing configuration files configGitProject N/A N/A Hardcoded in the class The configuration files are stored in the same Git project which stores the pipeline code itself.
Git branch name of repository storing configuration files configGitBranch Pipeline call Config_Git_Branch N/A The configuration files are stored in the same Git project which stores the pipeline code itself. You may use adifferent branch for the configuration files, though, if you want to store and use confiurations for e.g. different Jenkins instances
Folder in the Git repository containing all configuration files configGitPath N/A N/A Hardcoded in the class The folder containing all configuration file is (root)/config
